column5: Here I sit in Thorold watching the snow fall. Apparently winter is not done with us yet. Good thing we finished harvesting the last of the pussy willows back at the beginning of the week. Now we can focus on the seedlings on our nice warm grow benches and get the grow house all sealed up.  Next week I hunt for crappie.
Flakes flying in Canton Ohio...........   I'm so over this crap!
Sunny and beautiful in the land North of 60*!!!

Here I sit in Thorold watching the snow fall. Apparently winter is not done with us yet. Good thing we finished harvesting the last of the pussy willows back at the beginning of the week. Now we can focus on the seedlings on our nice warm grow benches and get the grow house all sealed up.  Next week I hunt for crappie. Just curious Bruce. What do you do with the pussy willows? And next week crappie fishing? Will you need an auger...lol
The pussy willow stems go to the flower  auction.  As for crappie.  A couple of my early spots are already almost clear of ice.
flower auction.    Is that a real thing?
The pussy willow stems go to the flower auction.   That has reality show written all over it

The auction or "clock" is a Dutch system that has been in place in Toronto around 50 years.  It brings flowers direct to the wholesale buyers without the need to have 2-300 small scale growers going from  shop to shop selling their crops At one time large enough to be sole North American distributor of indoor potted flowers to Lowes USA, and one of a handful of nationwide distributors to Home Depot USA.  That was back when our dollar was below $.70 US

The pussy willow stems go to the flower auction.  As for crappie. A couple of my early spots are already almost clear of ice.  Would they have the furry part on them at this time of the year?  Mine don't.
They are partially open already. We force them to be fully open for auction.
There is no sign of open water anywhere in our area, most years we have ice out somewhere between April 1 and 15th. I have a feeling it is going to be a lot closer to the end of April this year.
And really good "Ontario" lamb has arrived at Fortinos in Woody at 5.99 lb. They were lined up this morning! It must be Easter.
